intro: Jambosa korthalsii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The fruit is a round, yellowish berry that ripens to a reddish hue, containing a single large seed surrounded by a sweet, edible pulp. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated in some regions for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
